title: Question:
author: BayAreaCoins
content: I made a Bitcoin Testnet exchange with Bitcoin because I thought it was helpful and a bit funny... https://altquick.com/exchange/market/BitcoinTestnetIt's actually had a surprisingly good response...  Everyone that downloads Bitcoin Core automatically has a wallet, it's good for testing websites and your own services, and it's hard to get whole Bitcoin Testnet coins due to 0.02 TBTC block reward every 20 minutes...Do you think Bitcoin Testnet has a chance vs stupid things like Dogecoin/Pepe coin or whatever fucktard thing of the week is to be the hot Altcoin of 2023?Immoral, stupid, genius?  Chime in <3 thanks!

comments.author: d3bt3
comments.body: Quote from: BayAreaCoins on May 06, 2023, 05:16:38 AMI made a Bitcoin Testnet exchange with Bitcoin because I thought it was helpful and a bit funny... https://altquick.com/exchange/market/BitcoinTestnetIt's actually had a surprisingly good response...  Everyone that downloads Bitcoin Core automatically has a wallet, it's good for testing websites and your own services, and it's hard to get whole Bitcoin Testnet coins due to 0.02 TBTC block reward every 20 minutes...Do you think Bitcoin Testnet has a chance vs stupid things like Dogecoin/Pepe coin or whatever fucktard thing of the week is to be the hot Altcoin of 2023?  I'm happy you created a place for people to exchange them so freely & openly.  Testnet tBTC coins are hard to come by nowadays, so those who still have keys can provide them to those who really need them. Via the simple market, on your reliable site (and with a faucet!).

comments.author: Rampagoe004
comments.body: I have opened your website. Sorry for giving the "maybe" response  . I should have answered "Yes" to you. I can't give a genius answer because I don't know how Testnet will work. Love your idea and I hope it beats some fucktard meme tokens

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: Quote from: BayAreaCoins on May 06, 2023, 05:16:38 AMDo you think Bitcoin Testnet has a chance vs stupid things like Dogecoin/Pepe coin or whatever fucktard thing of the week is to be the hot Altcoin of 2023?Immoral, stupid, genius?  Bitcoin testnet exchange is somewhat a great idea, it seeks those who need those coins for whatever purpose, especially if they need it immediately. I understand that regtest could be utilized for development and testing processes, and should be used specifically for that purpose. But sometimes it might require testnet coin to test the platform/project synchronously within the network. Nevertheless, I don't have a high hope that such kind of initiative will go long-lasting, or leading even though it is compared to meme coins/tokens.

comments.author: Bitstar_coin
comments.body: Geth has a value now and can be bought using mainnet coins like eth, arb, op through layerzero site. Geth is highly sorted out by testers because it is required for like 90% of testing. Well the same can be for tbtc if there is a demand for it, i mean if we start to have btc20 projects who knows?

comments.author: d3bt3
comments.body: The actual (alt)coin with utility!  Utilized in Bitcoin development of exchanges, trading bots, tumblers, hardware devices & everything else.
